author: Zahra Mulroy
title: Genius tip shows how to clean your oven tray in seconds - with just TWO ingredients
text:
Some household tasks are more painful than others (Photo: Getty) Share Get     
Of all the domestic chores , some are notoriously grim, hard-work and unenjoyable. 
You know the sort. Cleaning the oven is probably the most hated, followed by cleaning the fridge, defrosting the freezer and unblocking the drains. 
Time-consuming, and you often wind up with rotten back ache. 
While there's no magic hack to make any of the above easier, there is one household chore you can make easier and quicker for yourself. 
Much like ovens, the trays we use in them have a habit of accumulating grot rapidly, but lifestyle blogger Jill Nystul , from Utah in the US has found the perfect formula for getting them clean. Jill's winning formula. 
Simply use a combination of baking soda and hydrogen peroxide. Read More Baking soda - the stuff of miracles (Photo: Getty) 
Jill, who has numerous pearls of cleaning wisdom on her blog instructs: 
"After sprinkling the spot with baking soda, spraying with hydrogen peroxide and then another layer of baking soda, I left it sitting there like that while we went to breakfast. 
"When we got home I rubbed a little of the cleaner off and was actually quite astonished to see most of the gunk came right off. And hydrogen peroxide too (Photo: www.alamy.com) 
"Minimal rubbing was required." 
Items such as baking soda and hydrogen peroxide are relatively cheap and easily available, and together are the perfect cleaning potion. Like us on Facebook
